segments.text: I notice the water is just pouring out of the sink, and it’s making a huge mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is standing right in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, taking those cookies without her knowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall off that stool, and it’s going to be a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting so calmly, like this is a normal thing to do.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless the woman is, just ignoring everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading fast, and it’s going to ruin the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I’m just watching like it’s not my problem.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so messy, and she’s just standing there drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t know how she can be so unaware of what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the calm garden and this mess inside is just too much.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like walking away and letting them deal with the consequences.
segments.speaker: PAR
